item.title: And Plat A Route is also a route planner with a more complete toolset to create walk, run, and bike routes, which you can share publicly or with a club of selected users: https://www.plotaroute.com. Powered by #OpenStreetMap. #plotaroute

On The Go Map is a route planner for running, walking, biking, or driving where you can plot your route points, see the elevation, and share the map: https://onthegomap.com. Powered by #OpenStreetMap. #onthegomap

#Ikuzo is a #map editor made specially ‚Äúfor travel photographers, influencers and other content creators‚Äù: https://ikuzo.app. Powered by #OpenStreetMap (although it opens points of interest POI in Google Maps). You can pin POI, add pictures, categorize (and filter) POI, and create travel plans (a collection of POI).
Let‚Äôs meet Gpoilvet, the #OpenStreetMap Mapper of the Month #MotM: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/05/01/gpoilvet.html.
Presentation of the key features of #MapRoulette by its author @mvexel at #SotM US: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=HXYnN5U1dn8

Activity on Fediverse and Mastodon is not about numbers and popularity contest but rather about quality and friendliness. Yet, I find it wise to celebrate üéâ and thank üôè my 300üíØüíØüíØfollowers for their interest ‚Äî a milestone that nicely aligns with celebrating 3,5 years on Mastodon, a bit more than 3,000 toots, and following more than 300 people. Seems like number 3Ô∏è‚É£ is a thing for me today. I never thought of such a journey when I joined. üòÉ
Nice to see the Tour de Romandie cycling race using #OpenStreetMap to display the route and even live positions: https://www.tourderomandie.ch #tourderomandie
A very nice introduction video to #OpenStreetMap by OSM US: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=UMhdo_o9NmU.

Should be of interest for #OpenStreetMap fellows. Free sample of a course in #Geography, #OpenLearn‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhy #Maps are Made‚Äù looks at maps in everyday life, their uses and their importance. Assessing the political importance of maps, it examines how we read maps and evaluate the information contained within them, looking at the values embedded in both maps themselves and our perceptions of them. https://www.open.edu/openlearn/society-politics-law/geography/why-maps-are-made/content-section-0

Development continues on #Microcosms to connect local #OpenStreetMap mappers in microcommunities. Watch this 15 min. talk at State of the Map US 2022 #StotM: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZcTgz6pZ65U.

#MDPI‚Äôs ‚ÄúSpecial Issue ‚Äî #OpenStreetMap as A Multi-Disciplinary Nexus: Perspectives, Practices and Procedures" is a collection of 15 #academic papers that compiles and extends the research works presented in the Academic Track of State of the Map 2019 #SotM: https://www.mdpi.com/journal/ijgi/special_issues/OpenStreetMap.

While some people at https://openbenches.org contribute to a map of 22,626 memorial #benches, an #AI at https://doesnotexist.openbenches.org use them to generate pictures of benches that don‚Äôt exist‚Ä¶ ü§™
#Facebook is running a survey to better understand your use of and contribution to #Mapillary: https://www.facebook.com/survey/?oid=332522592184448 #OpenStreetMap

Do you have your #OpenStreetMap business cards with you when going field mapping? They can be handy to hand out to people who ask 'what are you doing?' when they spotted you wandering around. - https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Business_card - https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/LySioS/diary/398913 (in French)
#Imagico shares his analysis of #OSM-related group communication channels and platforms: http://blog.imagico.de/osm-related-group-communication-channels-and-platforms-revisited/ #OpenStreetMap

The #OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF is launching a new communication platform for the OpenStreetMap community, powered by #Discourse at https://community.openstreetmap.org. Via https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/03/21/a-new-discussion-forum-for-osm/
osm.el is an #OpenStreetMap viewer for #Emacs: https://github.com/minad/osm. Crazy? Or genius? Or the two?

#RouteXL is a free webapp for road itinerary planning with optimization for multiple stops to save travel time and cost. Free to use for routes up to 20 stops. More stops come at a fee. Powered by #OpenStreetMap data. - Website: http://www.routexl.com - Demo video: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=ddKwv42XFxI

"Pin je punt" (‚ÄúPin your points of interest‚Äù) has been launched by Toerisme Vlaanderen and the provincial touristic organizations. The campaign uses #MapComplete to collect POIs that are relevant for recreational walking and cycling, namely e-bike charging stations, public toilets, benches and picnic tables, watchtowers, public bicycle pumps and repair stations, bicycle rentals and playgrounds. More info: https://toerismevlaanderen.be/nl/nieuws/pin-je-punt-maakt-van-vlaanderen-een-nog-aangenamere-fiets-en-wandelbestemming #OpenStreetMap

Introducing #Imagico‚Äôs #TagDoc project. As an alternative to #OpenStreetMap Wiki, TagDoc wants to be a ‚Äúcentralized, authoritative system of attributes and rules, developed and imposed by some centralized bureaucracy‚Äù (sic), aiming to ‚Äúdocument the de facto meaning of tags‚Äù. http://blog.imagico.de/introducing-the-tagdoc-project/
